engine_failure.description: Procedures for handling complete or partial engine failure during flight
procedures: Look for suitable emergency landing area
tips: Altitude is your friend - don't waste it
Aim for the first third of your chosen field
Turn off fuel and electrical systems before impact

severe_weather.description: Handling severe weather diversions and emergency procedures
tips: Don't try to penetrate severe weather
Have multiple alternate airports planned
Monitor weather updates continuously

communication_failure.description: Procedures when radio communication is lost
procedures: Continue on last assigned route and altitude
Rock wings to acknowledge light signals
tips: Squawk 7600 is universally recognized
Guard frequency is monitored by all ATC
Know light gun signals before you need them

patient_loading.description: Safe and efficient patient loading procedures for EMS flights
procedures: Shut down engines completely before loading
Brief medical team on aircraft safety
Verify patient is stable for transport
tips: Patient safety is always the priority
Never rush the loading process
Communicate with medical team throughout

procedures: Request priority landing at nearest hospital
Communicate patient status to receiving hospital
Execute rapid but safe approach and landing
tips: Fly the aircraft first, then assist medical team
Know locations of all nearby hospitals
Practice emergency descent procedures
Speak clearly and slowly
Repeat important information
Don't be afraid to declare emergency

atc_coordination.description: Effective coordination with Air Traffic Control
procedures: Request priority clearance for EMS flights
tips: EMS flights usually get priority handling
Be specific about your requirements
Maintain professional communication

procedures: Check for ground accessibility for EMS
tips: Always have backup landing sites identified
Soft ground is better than hard surfaces
Consider emergency vehicle access

short_field_operations.description: Techniques for short field takeoffs and landings
procedures: Use full flaps for maximum lift
Rotate at recommended short field speed
Maintain best angle of climb speed
Land on numbers for maximum rollout
tips: Know your aircraft's short field performance
Account for wind and density altitude
Practice these procedures regularly
